page.title: 11INDUSTRY
page.content: {Yorkshire Main}coal is a natural product formed from prehistoric forests.{Yorkshire Main}in{Edlington} sits on the{Barnsley Seam,}and has approximately five years coal production remaining. The main shaft is 1 000m deep. There are twenty workers who actually mine the coal, which is taken to the bottom of the shaft by conveyor, where it is taken to the surface by the cage, signalled by the ringing of a bell. The foot of the shaft is large and well lit. Away from the shaft the men carry their own lighting equipment. On the surface the coal is then washed and graded ready for distribution.{Miners}are shift workers starting their eight hour shift at either 6 am, 2 pm or 10 pm, with time allowed for changing.
